name: Infant Vaccine Promotion
description: FLWs review a child's vaccination status, provide recommendations for missing vaccines, and answer common questions about vaccine status
long_description: This intervention involves reviewing the vaccination status of children, counseling caregivers on missed vaccines, and promoting uptake to improve coverage,. In 2024, pilots were conducted (including in Malawi) where participants interacted with an AI chatbot to practice motivational interviewing techniques and role-play to improve engagement with caregivers regarding vaccine hesitancy,. While cost-effective, current strategies are pivoting toward integrating this work with broader child-related content to ensure high impact.

name: Household Safety Check
description: A simple intervention designed to reduce hazards and improve household safety through cost-appropriate recommendations
long_description: This program focuses on reducing household hazards to improve safety for families. Frontline workers provide simple, cost-appropriate recommendations to residents to mitigate risks within their home environments

name: Child Health Campaign
description: FLWs conduct door-to-door visits to children under five to administer Vitamin A, distribute ORS with Zinc, and conduct malnutrition screenings
long_description: This program is a high-impact intervention where frontline workers visit households to deliver essential health services to children under five, including Vitamin A supplementation, deworming, and the distribution of ORS and Zinc,. With major funding from GiveWell and Founders Pledge, Dimagi is scaling this program in high-need regions like Nigeria, utilizing digitally verified delivery to ensure equitable coverage and utilizing local lead organizations to manage implementation

name: Kangaroo Mother Care
description: FLWs conduct home visits to promote Kangaroo Mother Care practices specifically for preterm and low-birth-weight newborns
long_description: This prorgram supports small and vulnerable newborns and their caregivers through community-based care in Kenya and Uganda,. The intervention focuses on developing standard operating procedures and implementation approaches to generate evidence for community-based demand and uptake of KMC practices

name: Readers
description: FLWs go door-to-door to screen individuals for presbyopia and distribute non-prescription reading glasses to those who need them
long_description: In this program, locally-led organizations recruit frontline workers who complete a self-paced digital learning course to become certified in screening and distributing reading glasses. Once certified, workers go door-to-door to screen community members and distribute glasses, capturing digital verification data such as GPS coordinates and photos of the vision test. A proof-of-concept pilot in Siaya County, Kenya, validated that health promoters could be effectively upskilled to deliver this service, which is linked to improved economic productivity and well-being for older adults

name: Mental Health
description: This intervention delivers Interpersonal Group Therapy, a proven method to treat depression, to groups of people over several sessions
long_description: Applicable for clinically depressed individuals, this program involves delivering Interpersonal Group Therapy to groups of approximately ten people over about eight sessions,. Dimagi has completed pilots in Uganda and is scaling up work with World Vision in Ethiopia to support mental health needs in underserved communities

name: WellMe
description: A 4-month digital program that builds frontline worker resilience through evidence-based coaching on stress management, self-care, and mindfulness
long_description: Addressing the problem of overburdened and burned-out frontline workers, WellMe provides a digital curriculum focused on stress management, relationships, and purpose. Studies have shown statistically significant increases in resilience and wellbeing among participants, and the program is now being offered to CommCare Connect users who can utilize the content in English

name: Early Childhood Development
description: A multi-visit parenting intervention delivering responsive caregiving content to improve childhood cognitive, social, and emotional development
long_description: This program utilizes a digital-first approach to train frontline workers to deliver a complex behavior change intervention involving repeat household visits (e.g., 3 to 10 visits),. FLWs guide caregivers on topics such as early learning, nutrition, and responsive caregiving. Pilots in Malawi, Nigeria, and Mozambique have demonstrated that workers can successfully learn the curriculum digitally and deliver high-quality visits that are verified through gold-standard observations

name: Mother Baby Wellness
description: FLWs deliver supportive coaching during pregnancy and after birth to improve maternal wellbeing and promote exclusive breastfeeding
long_description: Currently in the design and testing phase with funding from GiveWell, this intervention trains FLWs to act as coaches for pregnant women and new mothers,. The program involves a series of coaching sessions (e.g., six visits) designed to increase exclusive breastfeeding rates and support maternal mental health, leveraging the success of similar coaching models used in Early Childhood Development programs

name: Rooftop Sampling
description: FLWs are assigned specific household to visit using a a rooftop sampling methodology
long_description: To ensure equitable coverage in door-to-door campaigns, CommCare Connect uses a clustering algorithm and open data sources (such as Open Buildings) to identify structures and estimate households within a worker's assigned area,. The system tracks where visits have occurred and prompts FLWs to visit areas that have not yet been reached (denoted by darker shading in app visualizations) to ensure saturation of the service area
